quiz.subject: JAVA
quiz.question: Incorrect statement(s) about finally block in java exception

options.a: Finally block always follow try catch block

options.b: finally block always executes whether exception is handled or not.

options.c: There can be multiple finally blocks followed by try catch block.

quiz.reason: In java exception handling, for each try block there can be zero or more catch blocks, but only one finally block.

quiz.subject: JAVA
quiz.question: True statement(s) about try catch block

options.a: Throws is used with the method signature.

options.b: Throw is used within the method.

options.c: using throws multiple exceptions can be declared

quiz.question: Which is not an exception in Java?

quiz.subject: JAVA
quiz.question: Which of these keywords must be used to handle the exception thrown by try block in some rational manner?
quiz.reason: If an exception occurs within the try block, it is thrown and cached by catch block for processing.

quiz.subject: JAVA
quiz.question: Which statement is true?

options.a: catch(X x) can catch subclasses of X where X is a subclass of Exception.

options.b: Any statement that can throw an Exception must be enclosed in a try block.

options.c: The Error class is a RuntimeException.

options.d: Any statement that can throw an Error must be enclosed in a try block.

quiz.reason: If the class specified in the catch clause does have subclasses, any exception object that subclasses the specified class will be caught as well.

quiz.subject: JAVA
quiz.question: Which of these is a super class of all errors and exceptions in the Java language?
quiz.reason: Throwable is a super class of all errors and exceptions in the Java language

quiz.subject: JAVA
quiz.question: Which of these keywords is used to by the calling function to guard against the exception that is thrown by called function?
quiz.reason: If a method is capable of causing an exception that it does not handle. It must specify this behaviour the behaviour so that callers of the method can guard themselves against that exception. This is done by using throws clause in methods declaration.

quiz.subject: JAVA
quiz.question: A single try block must be followed by which of these?
quiz.reason: try block can be followed by any of finally or catch block, try block checks for exceptions and work is performed by finally and catch block as per the exception.

quiz.subject: JAVA
quiz.question: Which of these exceptions will occur if we try to access the index of an array beyond its length?
quiz.reason: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is a built in exception that is caused when we try to access an index location which is beyond the length of an array.
